item.description:
Report X-2024051335

  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO AN OUUTBOUND TRAILER FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. UTILIZING ALL NECESSARY PPE THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TUB. ANY SPILLAGE WAS CLEANED UP ACCORDING TO DECISION TREE PROCEEDURES. THE PACKAGE AND DEBRIS WAS MOVED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024050671
item.description:
Report E-2024050671

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XKC. It was reported that approximately 10 gallons of Pro Methanol were released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3150396.

item.title: Report E-2024050663
item.description:
Report E-2024050663

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO XKC contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Kansas City, KS. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of Alkyd Fibrated Non Skid Coating, which released from 1-1 gallon metal can when another skid collided with the box containing the cans of paint, causing one of them to break open and spill out onto the dock and the box, impacting a total of 4-1 gallon cans.
